artist: Artist: Unknown Japanese; Publisher: Sawa Kyūjirō; Carver: Kō
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: vertical ōban triptych; triptych forming a single image; soldiers in black uniforms climbing a rocky cliff on right; soldier in center, raising a sword in PR hand, with face peering out behind him; twisted tree on right; rising hazy mountains and forested cliffs on left; instription in Japanese characters in red pigment in left margin of left image
inscription: in left sheet, in top margin, in pencil: 21
markings: LLB red carver\'s seal: 彫幸 {hori Kō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper with burnishing
text: The printed date of November 1894 refers to the first edition of this triptych with the title Picture of the Great Fierce Battle of Fenghuangcheng (鳳凰城大激戰之圖). This version was printed later with new title.
title: Picture of the Second Army Landing at Jinzhou
